title: Josh Frydenberg named Melbourne Storm's No.1 ticket holder
text:
NRL club Melbourne Storm has named federal Treasurer Josh Frydenberg its No.1 ticket holder for next season.

It’s not exactly the top drawer accolade a Victorian minister might aspire to. In the AFL-mad state, the game they play in jail is very much an Off-Broadway pastime.

The last Liberal treasurer from Bleak City, Peter Costello, was No.1 ticket holder of Essendon Football Club, as was Labor finance minister Lindsay Tanner. And of course Julia Gillard occupied the post at the Western Bulldogs.

But as a Carlton FC supporter, Frydenberg would have to dislodge Sam Smorgon of the industrial dynasty that began in the 1920s with a butcher’s shop in the inner-Melbourne suburb, who’s held the position since 1997 (almost as long as the Blues have gone without a premiership).

Still, you’d have to like Frydenberg’s chances of getting there eventually. Smorgon’s predecessors are Sir Robert Menzies, his wife Dame Patti and another southern Liberal PM, Malcolm Fraser.

Until then, the (Second) Colt from Kooyong will just have to chip away at Scott Morrison’s Cronulla Sharks.
description: NRL club Melbourne Storm has named federal Treasurer Josh Frydenberg its No.1 ticket holder for next season.
